verses.roman:
tasya cāpatataḥ khaḍgaṁ
tilaśaś carma ceṣubhiḥ
chittvāsim ādade tigmaṁ
rukmiṇaṁ hantum udyataḥ

synonyms: tasya—of him; ca—and; āpatataḥ—who was attacking; khaḍgam—the sword; tilaśaḥ—into small pieces; carma—the shield; ca—and; iṣubhiḥ—with His arrows; chittvā—breaking; asim—His sword; ādade—He took; tigmam—sharp; rukmiṇam—Rukmī; hantum—to kill; udyataḥ—prepared.
translation: As Rukmī attacked Him, the Lord shot arrows that broke Rukmī's sword and shield into small pieces. Kṛṣṇa then took up His own sharp sword and prepared to kill Rukmī.
